definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: In 1859 she published a book called Notes on Hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 1859年她出了一本叫做《醫院紀要》的書。

sentences.english: The summary of talk would be effective 7 days after the signature of the both sides.
sentences.chinese: 本會談紀要自雙方簽署之日起七日後生效。

sentences.english: There was no indication of the size of possible asset purchases by the Fed.
sentences.chinese: 紀要沒有提供有關美聯儲可能的資產購買規模的暗示。

sentences.english: The report of the meeting was sent directly to Saddam’s son, Odey.
sentences.chinese: 會議紀要被直接送至薩達姆的兒子奧迪手中。

sentences.english: And the attachment has the same validity as this document.
sentences.chinese: 紀要的附件與本紀要具有同等效力。

sentences.english: Both parties agree to take effective measures to implement the minute as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 雙方同意採取有效措施，儘快將紀要內容落到實處。

sentences.english: The findings appeared last month in The Archives of General Psychiatry.
sentences.chinese: 結果發表在上個月的《普通精神病學紀要》中。

sentences.english: Record and transcribe minutes of meetings.
Our language colleagues all agreed with our opinion.
sentences.chinese: 雙方就會談紀要取得一致意見。

definition: dove faction (opposite: 鹰派, hawks)/peace party/the faction seeking peace
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
The Sun (the name of various newspapers, notably in the UK and in Hong Kong)
